condition_subtext: Never used. May come with original packaging or tag.
listing_description:
Cyclists face squeaky, creaking noises while pedalling on their bicycles sometimes.

 It takes a mechanic with excellent troubleshooting skills to isolate the source of the noise.

Sometimes it can be the crankset, the spindle or bearings inside the bottom bracket, the chain, the jockey wheels, the derailleur in the rear, the cassette....the list goes on.

Patience and good listening ears are key to finding out where the squeak or creak comes from.

Eventually, we found that the bottom bracket needs to be removed and serviced.  Never leave any stone unturn.

Lesson learnt:
Always service your bicycle like you always service your car or motorcycle engines.

We welcome all cyclists with creaking noise coming from your bicycle while pedalling to come to our workshop for a ONE time free consultation and  service of your bicycle drive train system. 

Take note that we operate only on an appointment basis on every Saturday afternoon session from 3-7pm.
